name: The Fool
uprightMeaning: New beginnings, taking a leap of faith, innocence, spontaneity, adventure, optimism, trust in the universe
reversedMeaning: Recklessness, lack of planning, naivety, poor judgment, risk-taking without consideration
description: The Fool represents new beginnings, fresh starts, and the courage to take a leap of faith. This card encourages you to embrace the unknown with optimism and trust.

name: The Magician
uprightMeaning: Manifestation, personal power, willpower, skill, concentration, resourcefulness
reversedMeaning: Manipulation, trickery, lack of focus, untapped talents, poor planning
description: The Magician represents the power to manifest your desires through focused will and action. You have all the tools you need to achieve your goals.

name: The High Priestess
uprightMeaning: Intuition, inner wisdom, mystery, secrets, subconscious mind, spiritual insight
reversedMeaning: Lack of intuition, secrets, hidden agendas, disconnect from inner voice
description: The High Priestess represents your inner wisdom and intuition. Trust your instincts and look within for answers to your questions.

name: The Empress
uprightMeaning: Fertility, abundance, nature, motherhood, creativity, nurturing, growth
reversedMeaning: Infertility, creative blocks, over-dependence, neglect of self
description: The Empress represents abundance, fertility, and the nurturing aspects of life. She embodies creativity, growth, and the power of nature.

name: The Emperor
uprightMeaning: Authority, structure, control, leadership, stability, discipline, father figure
reversedMeaning: Tyranny, rigidity, lack of discipline, abuse of power, immaturity
description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and leadership. He brings order and stability through discipline and clear boundaries.

name: The Hierophant
uprightMeaning: Tradition, spirituality, teaching, conformity, religious beliefs, seeking guidance
reversedMeaning: Rebellion, non-conformity, personal beliefs, challenging tradition
description: The Hierophant represents traditional values, spiritual teaching, and the search for meaning through established systems and beliefs.

name: The Lovers
uprightMeaning: Love, relationships, choices, harmony, values, alignment, commitment
reversedMeaning: Imbalance, misalignment, poor choices, disharmony, lack of commitment
description: The Lovers represent love, relationships, and important choices. This card asks you to align your values with your actions.

name: The Chariot
uprightMeaning: Determination, control, willpower, victory, overcoming obstacles, focus
reversedMeaning: Lack of control, aggression, no direction, defeat, giving up
description: The Chariot represents determination and the will to succeed. You have the strength and focus to overcome any obstacle.

name: Strength
uprightMeaning: Inner strength, courage, patience, compassion, self-control, gentle power
reversedMeaning: Weakness, self-doubt, lack of self-discipline, inner turmoil
description: Strength represents inner courage and the power to overcome challenges through patience and compassion rather than force.

name: The Hermit
uprightMeaning: Soul-searching, introspection, guidance, solitude, inner wisdom, seeking truth
reversedMeaning: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, lack of direction, ignoring inner voice
description: The Hermit represents a time of introspection and soul-searching. Look within for answers and trust your inner guidance.

name: Wheel of Fortune
uprightMeaning: Change, cycles, fate, karma, good luck, destiny, turning point
reversedMeaning: Bad luck, resistance to change, external control, setbacks
description: The Wheel of Fortune represents the cyclical nature of life and the inevitability of change. What goes up must come down, and vice versa.

name: Justice
uprightMeaning: Justice, fairness, truth, balance, cause and effect, accountability
reversedMeaning: Unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty, imbalance
description: Justice represents fairness, truth, and the law of cause and effect. Every action has consequences, and balance will be restored.

name: The Hanged Man
uprightMeaning: Sacrifice, surrender, letting go, new perspective, waiting, suspension
reversedMeaning: Stalling, needless sacrifice, fear of sacrifice, resistance
description: The Hanged Man represents surrender and letting go. Sometimes the best action is inaction, and a new perspective can change everything.

name: Death
uprightMeaning: Transformation, endings, change, rebirth, letting go, new beginnings
reversedMeaning: Resistance to change, stagnation, fear of change, holding on
description: Death represents transformation and the end of one phase to make way for another. It's about letting go and embracing change.

name: Temperance
uprightMeaning: Balance, moderation, patience, harmony, healing, self-control
reversedMeaning: Imbalance, excess, lack of patience, discord, recklessness
description: Temperance represents balance and moderation in all things. It's about finding the middle path and practicing patience.

name: The Devil
uprightMeaning: Temptation, bondage, materialism, shadow self, addiction, unhealthy patterns
reversedMeaning: Freedom, breaking free, releasing addictions, reclaiming power
description: The Devil represents the shadow self and the things that bind us. It's about recognizing and breaking free from unhealthy patterns.

name: The Tower
uprightMeaning: Sudden change, revelation, disruption, breakthrough, liberation, awakening
reversedMeaning: Avoiding disaster, fear of change, internal explosion, delayed breakdown
description: The Tower represents sudden, dramatic change that breaks down old structures to make way for something new and better.

name: The Star
uprightMeaning: Hope, inspiration, spirituality, renewal, healing, guidance, optimism
reversedMeaning: Hopelessness, despair, lack of faith, disconnection, pessimism
description: The Star represents hope and inspiration after a difficult time. It's a sign of healing and spiritual renewal.

name: The Moon
uprightMeaning: Illusion, intuition, unconscious, mystery, confusion, fear, deception
reversedMeaning: Releasing fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion, clarity
description: The Moon represents the realm of dreams, illusions, and the unconscious mind. Things may not be as they appear.

name: The Sun
uprightMeaning: Joy, success, vitality, optimism, confidence, achievement, happiness
reversedMeaning: Temporary depression, lack of success, pessimism, low confidence
description: The Sun represents joy, success, and vitality. It's a card of optimism and the promise of good things to come.

name: Judgement
uprightMeaning: Judgement, rebirth, absolution, awakening, inner calling, forgiveness
reversedMeaning: Self-doubt, lack of self-awareness, fear of judgement, inner critic
description: Judgement represents a time of reckoning and rebirth. It's about answering your inner calling and being reborn into a new phase of life.

name: The World
uprightMeaning: Completion, achievement, integration, success, fulfillment, wholeness
reversedMeaning: Lack of closure, incomplete, no success, fear of completion
description: The World represents completion and achievement. You have reached a major milestone and are ready for the next phase of your journey.

name: Ace of Cups
uprightMeaning: New love, emotional fulfillment, spiritual awakening, intuition, compassion, new relationships
reversedMeaning: Emotional loss, blocked creativity, depression, emotional instability
description: The Ace of Cups represents the beginning of emotional fulfillment and new love. It signals a time of emotional renewal and spiritual awakening.

name: Two of Cups
uprightMeaning: Partnership, love, connection, harmony, mutual respect, emotional balance
reversedMeaning: Imbalance, broken communication, lack of harmony, separation
description: The Two of Cups represents partnership, love, and emotional connection. It suggests a harmonious relationship based on mutual respect and understanding.

name: Three of Cups
uprightMeaning: Celebration, friendship, community, joy, social gatherings, emotional support
reversedMeaning: Isolation, betrayal, gossip, lack of support, social anxiety
description: The Three of Cups represents celebration, friendship, and community. It's a time for joy, social connection, and emotional support from others.

name: Four of Cups
uprightMeaning: Apathy, contemplation, disconnection, missed opportunities, emotional withdrawal
reversedMeaning: New opportunities, re-engagement, awareness, acceptance
description: The Four of Cups represents a time of emotional withdrawal and contemplation. You may be missing opportunities or feeling disconnected from your emotions.

name: Five of Cups
uprightMeaning: Loss, grief, disappointment, regret, emotional pain, focusing on what's lost
reversedMeaning: Moving on, acceptance, finding peace, new opportunities
description: The Five of Cups represents loss, grief, and disappointment. It's about processing emotional pain and learning to move forward.

name: Six of Cups
uprightMeaning: Nostalgia, childhood, innocence, reunion, happy memories, emotional healing
reversedMeaning: Living in the past, emotional immaturity, difficulty moving on
description: The Six of Cups represents nostalgia and happy memories. It's about reconnecting with your inner child and finding joy in simple pleasures.

name: Seven of Cups
uprightMeaning: Choices, illusion, fantasy, overwhelm, many options, need for clarity
reversedMeaning: Clarity, focus, making decisions, reality check
description: The Seven of Cups represents choices and the need to distinguish between fantasy and reality. You may have many options but need to focus on what's real.

name: Eight of Cups
uprightMeaning: Walking away, disappointment, abandonment, search for meaning, emotional withdrawal
reversedMeaning: Avoiding necessary endings, fear of walking away, staying in unhealthy situations
description: The Eight of Cups represents walking away from something that no longer serves you. It's about leaving behind what's not working to find something better.

name: Nine of Cups
uprightMeaning: Satisfaction, emotional fulfillment, wishes granted, contentment, happiness, gratitude
reversedMeaning: Disappointment, unfulfilled wishes, lack of satisfaction, overindulgence
description: The Nine of Cups represents emotional fulfillment and satisfaction. Your wishes are coming true, and you're experiencing deep contentment.

name: Ten of Cups
uprightMeaning: Happiness, harmony, family, fulfillment, emotional completion, joy, love
reversedMeaning: Dysfunctional relationships, lack of harmony, family problems, emotional instability
description: The Ten of Cups represents emotional fulfillment and happiness in relationships. It's about finding harmony and joy in your connections with others.

name: Page of Cups
uprightMeaning: Emotional messages, intuition, creativity, sensitivity, new emotional experiences
reversedMeaning: Emotional immaturity, blocked creativity, lack of intuition, insensitivity
description: The Page of Cups represents emotional messages and new creative opportunities. It's about trusting your intuition and exploring your creative side.

name: Knight of Cups
uprightMeaning: Romance, charm, emotional pursuit, idealistic, following your heart
reversedMeaning: Moodiness, emotional manipulation, unrealistic expectations, lack of commitment
description: The Knight of Cups represents romantic pursuit and following your heart. It's about being guided by emotions and ideals rather than logic.

name: Queen of Cups
uprightMeaning: Emotional maturity, intuition, compassion, nurturing, emotional intelligence
reversedMeaning: Emotional manipulation, moodiness, lack of boundaries, emotional instability
description: The Queen of Cups represents emotional maturity and intuitive wisdom. She embodies compassion, nurturing, and emotional intelligence.

name: King of Cups
uprightMeaning: Emotional balance, compassion, diplomacy, control, emotional intelligence, leadership
reversedMeaning: Emotional manipulation, moodiness, lack of emotional control, coldness
description: The King of Cups represents emotional balance and compassionate leadership. He combines emotional intelligence with diplomatic skills.

name: Ace of Wands
uprightMeaning: Positive energy, action, movement, progress in wands matters
reversedMeaning: Blocked energy, lack of action, stagnation in wands matters
description: The Ace of Wands represents energy and action in wands matters. It's about taking initiative and moving forward.

name: Two of Wands
uprightMeaning: Positive energy, action, movement, progress in wands matters
reversedMeaning: Blocked energy, lack of action, stagnation in wands matters
description: The Two of Wands represents energy and action in wands matters. It's about taking initiative and moving forward.

description: The Page of Wands represents page energy in wands matters. It's about taking action and showing leadership.
